description: The overall objective of DRM Programme is to “decrease the risk of natural and man-made hazards to rural and urban livelihoods, and ensure infrastructure and recovery mechanisms in place”.

subproject.description: Project Title: Disaster Risk Management Programme
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality

subproject.description:
Project outputs:
1. Support for Recover and Response Planning Project.
2. Flash Floods Early Warning Project.
3. Urgent Increase in Urban Water Supplies.
4. Strengthening of UNERT to respond landslides and flash floods
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Compound Crisis Response

subproject.description:
Project outputs:
The main project output: National authorities are better able to respond to disasters and improved their capacity to prepare and conduct search and rescue operations.
Activity results are as follows:
Activity result 1:
At least one USAR-team located in Dushanbe will be equipped to be operational in national Urban Search and Rescue operations.
Activity result 2:
One outdoor training facility for USAR (rubble field) in Dushanbe established.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Support to Urban Search&Rescu

subproject.description:
Project outputs: 
- Capacity of the CoES to predict, prevent and manage natural disasters is improved.
- CoES provides emergency management and related trainings in accordance with international standards
- Disaster risk management is integrated into planning at local levels
subproject.title: Strengt Disaster Risk Mgmt III

subproject.title: National Disaster Response cap

subproject.description:
Project outputs:
- Support UN Resident Coordinator  and UNCT  in Tajikistan to be better prepared for providing a coordinated response to humanitarian needs emanating from acute and chronic vulnerability;
- Enhancing in country capacity in disaster-related information management and improving the response actions to the risks of compound crisis by creating an effective Risk Monitoring/Early Warning system (RMWS)
- Strengthening the capacity in country  to effectively engage in Early Recovery (ER) coordination, planning and implementation.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Streng Early Recovery/Warning
